reasoning: Intraocular pressure disorder (elevated IOP) is a key risk factor for glaucoma with prevalence estimates of 3-4% in adults globally. Using prevalence metric (existing cases) rather than incidence due to chronic nature and gradual development.
source: Quigley HA et al. (2006). The number of people with glaucoma worldwide in 2010 and 2020. Br J Ophthalmol. 90(3):262-267
